item.description:
Rabbit Hole - Rhode Island College

Bring your Kleenex. This is a play about grief, about a 4-year-old boy hit by a car and killed, and how the people left behind deal with it. With Cynthia Nixon debuting on Broadway, it received the 2007 Pulitzer for Drama. It sounds intense, but very genuine. Read the NYT review for more info.

The play starts at 8 pm in the Helen Forman Theatre in the John Nazarian Center for the Performing Arts. We'll meet at 7:30 pm in the theatre lobby.

*Tickets are $15. Please purchase your own ticket through RIC, either in person or by phone, (401) 456-8144 from 10 a.m. - 4 p.m. M-F. Don't wait, as tickets may sell out.*

After the play, everyone is welcome to come to my house (just around the corner) for appetizers, drinks and a little cheer!
item.how_to_find_us: Will meet in theatre lobby -- look for small Meetup sign
item.name: Rabbit Hole - RIC
